Я как раз в ФБ об этом новость запостил: <http://techcrunch.com/2015/10/14/linkedin-debuts-referrals-relaunches-recruiter-with-people-matching-algorithms/?ncid=rss>

attachments.title: LinkedIn Debuts Referrals, Relaunches Recruiter With People-Matching Algorithms
attachments.text:
LinkedIn — the platform used by some 380 million professionals for networking, job hunting, learning things and more — today took the wraps off two new products aimed at one of LinkedIn’s biggest groups of paying users: talent recruiters.
At LinkedIn’s Talent Connect event in Anaheim, California, the company announced Referrals, a way for companies to automate the process of tapping into their existing employee networks to hire new people; and it also debuted a rebuilt Recruiter, which will now let HR people find job candidates based on similar people profiles, as well as with more simplified search strings based on new algorithms. Significantly, both products are focused on ways of maximising the data that exists in the LinkedIn walled garden, rather than venturing into the wider web to do this.
The Recruiter platform will start to get rolled out in Q1 of next year, while Referrals is getting rolled out now.
The main idea of the new Recruiter platform — already used by some 38,000 businesses — is that it will now be focused around a much more algorithmic approach to finding new employees. As LinkedIn’s head of talent solutions Eddie Vivas describes it, the change was born out of a challenge that LinkedIn could see facing recruiters on the platform: it’s just hard to find the right person in an efficient way.
There is too much time spent trying to find the right candidates for a job, with recruiters focused on accurate search strings and so on. And the knock on effect for LinkedIn is a frustrating experience for recruiters using LinkedIn as a platform to find candidates, which doesn’t provide a good hit rate.
“I don’t know what my search criteria is, but this rockstar on my team is exactly what I’m looking for,” is how Vivas puts the
So this is what LinkedIn is trying to tackle: using algorithms and AI — a growing trend at the company as it tries to add more intuitive and predictive elements to its services — LinkedIn is providing a way for recruiters to effectively use one employee’s profile as the search criteria for subsequent candidates. On top of this, if you don’t have a specific “rockstar” in mind, you can use a premade set of search tags to find a list of candidates more quickly.
LinkedIn says that while the tech in this product has been built from scratch, it does rely on talent from at least two of the company’s recent acquisitions: Careerify, which it acquired earlier this year in part for its employee referral software; and <http://Bright.com|Bright.com> a job search startup where Vivas was a cofounder.
But if you follow the online recruitment space at all, you might see a resemblance with another company that LinkedIn does not own: Connectifier, a startup founded by ex-Googlers, has also built a way to proactively find candidates based on the profiles of employees who you already love. The difference between the two is the like Google, Connectifier crawls the web at large for its data and search results; while LinkedIn stays close within its walled garden.
Vivas — who says that any resemblance with Connectifier is coincidental — says that part of the reason for LinkedIn opting to use only its own data is because it’s more relevant for searches across different verticals beyond tech.
“When it comes to tech recruiting it’s interesting to pull data from Github and Stack Overflow, but if you think about verticals like nursing or finance, it’s hard to think of how social profiling would work,” he said. The other is that it’s more respectful to potential candidates, who are only being assessed on information that there are already putting out there for potential recruitment purposes, by registering with LinkedIn in the first place.

Referrals, meanwhile, are tackling a different pain point for LinkedIn and HR people: while they like to use their employee networks to suggest potential hires, most of them are finding that few employees act on the opportunity, no matter what kind of monetary bonus is waved in front of them. That’s because they are busy with their own jobs, or just may not want to spend time thinking about this.
The idea here is to apply AI once again, this time for a job profile to be effectively “sent” to an employee who is on LinkedIn, whose own network of contacts then gets matched against that to find a good fit. As with other new products that LinkedIn is building that take some of the work out of using the site, the idea with Referrals is that it will “learn” about candidates and also employees. So, for example, if someone is presented as a match for a marketing job but actually has no experience in that area, or you happen to know that the person is actually trying to move away from marketing, the Referrals engine won’t suggest that individual the next time that a marketing role comes up.
I’ll be keen to see whether LinkedIn applies some of that learning to other aspects of its site over time, too, where connection requests and other parts of the site that today feel a little overwhelming get better prioritized.






The new Recruiter interface initially will be desktop only, and both will be English-first before expanding to other languages. While Recruiter will be a free upgrade for those who already pay for the Recruiter product, Referrals will be priced between $10 and $20 per employee per year based on the number of employees in your organization.
attachments.fallback: TechCrunch Link: LinkedIn Debuts Referrals, Relaunches Recruiter With People-Matching Algorithms

вот описание того о чем писала
в общем буду признательна за рекомендации

Role
Big Data Sales and Solution Lead - Europe

Job Description  
We are looking for a big thinker who enjoys the sales process as well as delivery. Someone who enjoys being in a client-facing role with top-tier companies embracing their goals and acting as part pre-sales, part delivery lead, and part architect. Think of this as joining a startup but being backed by a well-established, innovative, and global company.

Operating as part of the newly formed Big Data Practice, you will help grow the practice in Europe by supporting sales activity and owning one or more client solution delivery teams operating in consultative capacity. You should be excited to wear many hats and the opportunity to build a team of talented individuals from the ground up. 

A solid understanding of Hadoop, NoSQL, streaming technologies, cloud services, and analytic tools is absolutely required. Not only will our clients expect you to be passionate and creative about using data to improve their business, they will expect you to coach them on market trends or how a wide-range of Big Data and traditional BI technologies can help.  You should be excited by an opportunity to support sales opportunities, spend time weighing the pros and cons of a architecture strategy with a client or manage a consulting engagement to completion. You will have the opportunity to dedicate time to staying fresh, attending conferences, and exploring new products/services that could bring value to our clients.   On top of an attractive salary and benefits package, Luxoft will invest into your professional training and enable you to grow your professional career.

Responsibilities: 
•	Support sales activity for new and existing vertical accounts or direct practice accounts – this may include building sales materials, attending onsite presentations, writing proposals, or attending conferences. 
•	Manage one or more delivery teams providing big data solution delivery services at a single client, or different clients.
•	Lead client projects ranging from strategy, to architecture, to implementation, to operational support.  
•	Provide technical leadership, career mentorship, and performance management for solution delivery resources on your team(s).
•	Work cross-functionally within Luxoft to build the Big Data practice across Europe (and potentially beyond for global companies).
•	Understand and monitor the vast big data ecosystem to stay fresh.
•	Act as a trusted advisor to clients during the pre-sales process including exploration discussions, deal formulation, team selection, and project launch.
•	Provide technical consultation and education to the business development team and actively support responding to client requests for proposals or SOWs.
•	Identify customer needs and requirements on a detailed level and consequently matching those back to proposed services or solutions.
•	Assist clients with trouble-shooting of existing solutions related to performance, scalability, maintenance, or cost of ownership
•	Support the talent screening and acquisition process for the big data practice.
•	Attend industry conferences and perform hands on evaluations of new products/services.
•	Travel to the prospect, client, and conference locations as necessary, but not in a full time capacity.

Desired Skills and Experience:
•	5-10 years of Professional Services (client-facing) experience architecting and/or implementing large, distributed data warehouses, big data, or real-time data intensive applications.
•	Direct participation in a presales process for selling professional services including account management and project management experience
•	Appreciation of typical client decision process, organization structures.
•	Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
•	Excellent client prospect and partner presentation skills, relationship building skills.
•	Experience with enterprise scale distributed NoSQL solutions such as HBase, Cassandra, MongoDB, etc.
•	Experience using and developing solutions utilizing the Hadoop ecosystem such Hadoop, Spark, Hive, Pig, Sqoop, Oozie, Ambari, HCatalog, Zookeeper, Flume, Storm, Kafka
•	Experience with Enterprise Data Warehouse Platforms such as Teradata, Netezza, Exadata, MSSQL, DB2, etc.
•	Strong aptitude for learning new technologies and evaluating fit for a client solution delivery environment
•	Ability to document, explain, and present complex architectures
•	Experience with Performance Management of direct reports, career coaching and mentorship
•	Experience managing team resources in a matrixed environment
•	Ability to follow and evangelize standard engineering principles and practices
•	A stringent focus on quality and attention to detail, while being able to achieve a desired outcome balanced with time and cost.
•	Experience with various cloud big data services such as Azure, AWS, Altiscale, Google Cloud, etc
•	Experience with a wide variety of common BI tools and emerging tools such as Platfora, DataMeer, Alteryx, etc.
•	Experience with data science enabling technologies such as R, Mahout

Руководитель проектов / Эксперт (Data Monetization, Big Data)

 

Обязанности:

Участие в формировании бизнес-требований для пилотирования идей по монетизации данных.

Участие в реализации и оценке пилотных инициатив.

Проверка гипотез, выявление паттернов и корреляций для подтверждения пилотной идеи.

Разработка и актуализация аналитических моделей.

Разработка и реализация программ обучения в области работы с большими данными.

Организация и проведение конференций по обмену опытом.

Участие в изменении и создании операционных процессов для тиражирования успешных пилотов.

Участие в тиражировании успешных пилотов.

Формирование бизнес-требований к источникам информации.

Ведение проектов по монетизации данных в качестве руководителя проекта

 

Требования:

Высшее образование в области математики и статистики.

Владение аналитическими навыками и инструментами.

Опыт и прикладные навыки построения предсказательной и предписывающей аналитики.

Опыт работы с большими массивами данных в крупных банках, телекоммуникационных, интернет консалтинговых компаниях, компаниях разработчиках аналитического прикладного ПО.

Умение использовать R, Python, Matlab, SAS, SPSS.

Навыки управления проектами и проектными командами.
